intro: Pereilema crinitum, commonly known as the hairy pereilema, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that are covered in fine, hairy structures. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Pereilema crinitum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
